summary: A letter from Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss to attorney Robert Glassman responding to a request for documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and plaintiff Jane Doe in the civil case Doe v. Indyke. The letter cites Touhy regulations, authorizes the release of certain documents (FedEx invoices, materials from electronic search warrants, and a photo from Epstein's residence), and notes restrictions due to grand jury secrecy.

persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the letter, authorizes the release of documents in response to a request from Robert Glassman, citing Department regulations.

persons.context: Recipient of the letter; made a request for documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and plaintiff Jane Doe in the case Doe v. Indyke.

connections.description: Glassman is the attorney representing Jane Doe in the civil case Doe v. Indyke, as indicated by the document request.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is formally responding to Glassman's document request on behalf of the Department of Justice.
Strauss's office is handling the release of documents related to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The Department of Justice, via Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, authorized the release of specific documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and plaintiff Jane Doe in response to a request from attorney Robert Glassman.

Released documents include FedEx invoices referencing Jane Doe (USDOL0001-0040), materials from electronic search warrants referencing her (USDOL0041-0052), and a photo of her obtained from a physical search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence (USDOJ_0053).

The release is governed by Touhy regulations (28 C.F.R. ยง 16.21 et seq.), which control disclosures by DOJ employees, and explicitly excludes any documents protected by grand jury secrecy rules (Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e)).
The document indicates an ongoing civil case, Doe v. Indyke (No. 20-cv-484), where discovery is being exchanged, and a pretrial conference was scheduled for August 5, 2020.
Information in the released documents has been redacted to exclude references to third parties, indicating protective measures for other individuals involved.
